learning_outcomes.description: Apply models (including the CMOP-E) to identify the elements of the person, environment and occupation which change across the lifespan, and explain how these changes are linked with occupational performance in occupational roles.
Explain how life circumstances (including health conditions and environmental factors - historical and current) impact occupational performance and roles.
Assess aspects of occupational performance following the protocol and scoring instructions of a standardised developmental assessment tool, and interpret findings of this assessment.
Work collaboratively with peers to analyse and assess occupational performance.

Convey the outcomes of the assessment of occupational performance to relevant stakeholders both verbally and in a written format, using professional language and expression appropriate to the audience.

Apply, demonstrate and evaluate strategies related to communicating openly, effectively and respectfully with peers and professional colleagues; as well as demonstrate skills and strategies related to working collaboratively with colleagues; and with relevant stakeholders.

assessments.task_description:
Two hour prac sessions will be held in weeks 1 and 3. Prac sessions must be attended as they count towards overall fieldwork hours. 

Students will be required to write and submit an assessment summary report. This task will be supported by two prac sessions held in weeks 1 and 3. The prac sessions will develop skills in assessing occupational performance of a young child, and administering, scoring and interpreting results from a standardised assessment. Students will record their work during the prac sessions using worksheets, in small groups. 

Participation within the learning activities within the Prac will form the foundation for the written report and oral viva. 

The Written Report will be worth 35% of your overall mark and will be submitted as a pair via Learn.uq by 4pm Friday Week 6. 

Note: This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Report and Reflection on Group Work is to be submitted via Learn.uq. Only one individual from the group/pair required to upload assessment item.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The oral viva will be completed individually via zoom, and involves discussing your written report with a 'clinical educator' and/or parent (examiner). 

Additional details of this assessment task will be available in the Assessment Folder on Learn.UQ. 


Please note: This viva assessment will be recorded via Zoom.
